text: The Battle of Héricourt, fought on 13 November 1474, was part of the Burgundian Wars, and resulted in victory for the Swiss Confederacy and a defeat for Burgundy and its allies. Héricourt was invested and quickly taken. The battle was a loss for the Burgundians, with 1,617 deaths. The battle was one of the first using hand-held guns.The Artillery of the Dukes of Burgundy, 1363-1477 Robert Douglas Smith, Kelly DeVries; Boydell Press, 2005 page 36, ==See also== *Battles of the Old Swiss Confederacy ==References== Category:1474 in Europe Category:1470s in the Holy Roman Empire Category:Battles of the Burgundian Wars Category:Conflicts in 1474
